result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony B Huber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: *Submit DNA sample (if not already done) and pay surcharge. *Payment of all court ordered obligations. *Payment of supervision fees. *Comply with any and all treatment recommended by the agent. *No consumption of any controlled substances.

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Sentencing Hearing 7-21-2016
Reporter Jill Bartol
to Court from DOC with Certificate of Completion of ERP

Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order-ERP
s/BNB/6-22-17

Defendant Anthony B Huber in court with attorney James D. Peebles.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that all parties have received a copy of the PSI and are prepared to proceed.  Atty Peebles has received the PSI and have reviewed it with his client; no corrections need to be made.
Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations and asks for 4 1/2 years Prison with 18 months initial confinement and 3 years extended supervision.
Atty Peebles makes sentencing arguments and asks for a probation sentence with jail time with huber.
Brian Huber makes a statement to the court.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Court orders 4 1/2 years in the Wisconsin State Prison System with 18 months Initial Confinement and 3 years Extended Supervision with conditions:
Report forthwith
*DNA Sample (if not done so already) + $250.00 Surcharge
*Court Costs = $268.00
*Payment of Court ordered obligations
*Payment of Supervision fees
*Comply with any and all treatment recommended by the agent
*No consumption of any controlled substances
*Eligible for Substance Abuse Program
  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.
Sentencing hearing on July 21, 2016 at 10:45 am.
Sentencing hearing on July 1, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Anthony B Huber in court with attorney James D. Peebles.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement. Atty Hendee states that parties are requesting a PSI and sentencing date.  Atty Peebles agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

Court questions the State.
Atty Hendee will leave it up to the court
Atty Peebles requests that the bond be continued until sentencing.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.
PSI ordered
Set for Sentencing
bond continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 1, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Atty Hendee has no objection.

BY THE COURT:  Reset.

BY THE COURT:  Reset to give time for treatment court evaluation.
